results.title: Bill Onus boomerangs
results.brief_description: Yorta Yorta activist, artist and entrepreneur Bill Onus shared his culture as an act of resistance and reclamation of power. Through his factory and shop, Aboriginal Enterprises, he shared his art and culture, selling boomerangs and other pieces.
results.description:
Boomerang 2: handmade and painted with stylised image of an animal, and abstract decoration at each end. Reverse bears artist’s stamp.
*TO BE DISPLAYED ON REVERSE SHOWING ARTIST’S STAMP
description_for_label:
Boomerang 2: handmade and painted with stylised image of an animal, and abstract decoration at each end. Reverse bears artist’s stamp.
*TO BE DISPLAYED ON REVERSE SHOWING ARTIST’S STAMP

results.title: Bill Onus boomerangs
results.brief_description: To Bill Onus, sharing his culture was an act of resistance and reclamation of power. The Yorta Yorta activist, artist and entrepreneur had roles in several Australian films, documented Aboriginal life through home movies and is likely one of the first Aboriginal filmmakers.
results.description: Boomerang 1: handmade and painted with image of kangaroo, shields, figure holding weapons, and abstract decoration at each end. Reverse bears artist’s stamp.
description_for_label: Boomerang 1: handmade and painted with image of kangaroo, shields, figure holding weapons, and abstract decoration at each end. Reverse bears artist’s stamp.

results.title: Reel to Reel Tape Recorder
results.brief_description: Used as the news gathering sound recorder at channel 7 sydney in the 1960s and early 1970s when external news footage was shot on 16mm reversal film. When it was upgraded with a Nagra 4.2 it became the in-house 1/4 inch transfer machine until Betacam became the dominant technology in the 1980s.
results.description: Used as the news gathering sound recorder at channel 7 sydney in the 1960s and early 1970s when external news footage was shot on 16mm reversal film. When it was upgraded with a Nagra 4.2 it became the in-house 1/4 inch transfer machine until Betacam became the dominant technology in the 1980s.
description_for_label: Used as the news gathering sound recorder at channel 7 sydney in the 1960s and early 1970s when external news footage was shot on 16mm reversal film. When it was upgraded with a Nagra 4.2 it became the in-house 1/4 inch transfer machine until Betacam became the dominant technology in the 1980s.

results.title: Make-up box complete with make up
results.brief_description:
Make-up box complete with make up from make up artist Paul Blackwell, owned by his widow Lee-Anne Donnolley
Note: Edie Kurzer has taken items out of the box and displayed them in the cabinet. I have tried to inventory them and assocatiate items back to the loaned make up case where possible (limited documentation photographs). Parts added are definitely from the case however other items on display may be originally from this object.
results.description: Make-up box complete with make-up from make-up artist Paul Blackwell, owned by his widow Lee-Anne Donnolley.
description_for_label: Make-up box complete with make-up from make-up artist Paul Blackwell, owned by his widow Lee-Anne Donnolley.
